column4: Could you check ls -la /dev/pts and does /var/run/utmp exist?
only thing in /dev/pts is "0"
That's not sufficient and is clearly wrong. That's why you have it. Out of my curiosity. The error message is a copy/paste? I wonder if the auther couldn't spell.
simcut@whatever:~$ ls -la /dev/pts
Once you have pastebin that please can I also ask if you mount command shows something like devpts on /dev/pts type devpts (rw,noexec,nosuid,gid=5,mode=0620)?
how do i check the mount command?
You type in mount in a terminal. IT shows you the mounted devices.
http://pastie.org/4457116

I read it. IT is clearly wrong and also wrongly mounted. See my suggestions on how it should look. You mentioned it is a VPS. Given that you have pasted it I assume you have full root access. However, I would suggest you contact the rack space provider. Explain to them that /dev/ptmx isn't properly mounted on /dev/pts and therefore you ran out of pseudo terminals.
This is how it should look like: devpts on /dev/pts type devpts (rw,noexec,nosuid,gid=5,mode=0620)
i think i mounted it last night myself
You...? Well, did you install the system? It shoudl be there just by default. Nothing much you can do wrong to be honest.
As I said, the best is to approach the provider and explain the situation. This is the root cause why your utmp throws the execption.
Besides, loggin in as root is not a bad thing. At some point a system needs to be administered. Don't blame him/her for that. ;-)
